title: Isolate Radical Term
text: Isolate the radical term on one side of the equation. We can add 8 on both sides get $$3\sqrt{7y+1}=18$$ which has radical term isolated on one side.

title: Isolate The Radical
text: We can isolate the radical by dividing by 3 both sides and get $$\sqrt{7y+1}=6$$.

title: Raise Both Sides Of the Equation To The Power Of The Index
text: $${\sqrt{7y+1}}^2=6^2$$ After squaring both sides, we get $$7y+1=36$$.

title: Check For Remaining Radicals
text: Are there any more radicals? No. We can proceed to the next step.

title: Solve For Equation
text: What is the value of y for $$7y+1=36$$?
